New Records: West Indies set a target of 137, which was the highest score in the match.
Roston Chase scored an unbeaten 42 off 27 balls, the highest individual score in the match.
The sixth-wicket partnership of 40 between Roston Chase and Andre Russell was the highest for the West Indies in the match.
Papua New Guinea scored 136, their highest total in a T20 World Cup match.
West Indies achieved their highest score in a T20 World Cup match with 137 for five.
Key Match Events: Roston Chase's unbeaten 42 and Andre Russell's 15 not out formed a crucial sixth-wicket partnership.
Assad Vala took a brilliant catch at backward point to dismiss Sherfane Rutherford.
Papua New Guinea were 97 for five with four overs left before Roston Chase took control.
The match was decided by a five-wicket victory for the West Indies with an over to spare.
Johnson Charles was dismissed first ball by Alei Nao, giving Papua New Guinea an early advantage.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies were expected to dominate against Papua New Guinea, a minnows side.
Papua New Guinea's bowling was praised for its discipline and simplicity.
The West Indies team aimed to improve their performance in all aspects of the game post-match.
Post-Match Reflections: Roston Chase was named Man of the Match for his performance with the bat and in the field.
Assad Vala praised his team's effort but acknowledged the tough loss.
Rovman Powell expressed relief at the victory but highlighted areas for improvement for the West Indies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Papua New Guinea's second appearance in the T20 World Cup was significant given their previous poor performance.
The match was played at the Guyana National Stadium in Providence.
The tight scoreline and competitive nature of the game were highlighted by analysts.
